It doesn't apply to Soraka. GW was nerfed to only apply to self-heals.
Likewise, EC's upgrade, Mortal Reminder, is only effective on extremely tanky targets.

Arguably, compare to other items the ADC can get, EC is only valuable against tank champions with a lot of regeneration. It works well against Mundo and Volibear, but otherwise it is better to get another item.
watch full AP raka land a Q on an enemy, then tell me they don't care about GW.

A lot of people complaining about this item. I doubt assassins are gonna build it against anything other than a tank. There is no need to. They have enough damage with their standard build+they get more utility from it. The item would be wasted on anything other than a bruiser that is snowballing or a top lane assassin that needs to burst a tank.
That really didn't stop burst mages from building DFG, and then using its active and their combos on squishies, even if there were tanks that the DFG was originally designed to bust in the same game.

Reminder: This item is still not an active, it's a passive. For an assassin vs a squishy, you'll either have too much damage to need the passive (and therefore get the reset) or not enough damage for the passive to matter. You'll also have more chances to outplay the passive (because if "wait for him to use Windwall" is valid counterplay, so is waiting for an assassin to accidentally pop this), making it less unfair to play against. 

Riot does learn things sometimes. They removed DFG for a reason. They won't put an AD version in for no reason just for it to be removed later.

The item is gold vs squishies, because if you kill the squishy before the mark pop you can get the passive reset and apply the mark multiple times in a fight, which can made for an even increasing snowball effect when an assassin can use the passive 2 or 3 times in a fight by killing squishies and then proceed to shred tanks later on in a fight
